body_html:
Windows 7 Pro 64 bit (6.1, build 7601)
Tensorflow installed via anaconda
Tensorflow version 1.2.1
Python version 3.5.3
As for Cuda etc this PC was set up some time ago there is a GPU installed is that sufficient or should I install CUDA/cuDNN separately? I don't think I'm currently using the GPU.
GPU: AMD radeon 6900 series 4095MB

The problem arises when the last line of block 11 is run,

https://github.com/ageron/handson-ml/blob/master/10_introduction_to_artificial_neural_networks.ipynb

It also arises when block 11 of this notebook is run:

https://github.com/ageron/handson-ml/blob/master/10_introduction_to_artificial_neural_networks.ipynb

It does not crash immediately it gets to a test accuracy of 92% (so quite close to the end) before crashing and given a blue screen of death.

Anything else you need just let me know.

body:
Windows 7 Pro 64 bit (6.1, build 7601)
Tensorflow installed via anaconda
Tensorflow version 1.2.1
Python version 3.5.3
As for Cuda etc this PC was set up some time ago there is a GPU installed is that sufficient or should I install CUDA/cuDNN separately? I don't think I'm currently using the GPU.
GPU: AMD radeon 6900 series 4095MB

The problem arises when the last line of block 11 is run,

https://github.com/ageron/handson-ml/blob/master/10_introduction_to_artificial_neural_networks.ipynb

It also arises when block 11 of this notebook is run:

https://github.com/ageron/handson-ml/blob/master/10_introduction_to_artificial_neural_networks.ipynb

It does not crash immediately it gets to a test accuracy of 92% (so quite close to the end) before crashing and given a blue screen of death.

Anything else you need just let me know.
